title: 110_hr2932
content: SECTION 1. NONMAILABILITY OF CERTAIN TOBACCO PRODUCTS. Section 1 of Chapter 30 of title 39, United States Code, prohibits the mailing of cigarettes, smokeless tobacco, and roll-your-own tobacco products. Violators may face civil penalties up to $100,000 per violation. The Postal Service may impose civil penalties for violations after a hearing. Factors considered include the nature of the violation, culpability, ability to pay, and prior violations. Civil actions can be taken to collect penalties. Civil actions can be brought in district courts to collect civil penalties assessed under the Postal Service regulations. Amounts received as penalties are deposited into the Treasury of the United States. The Postal Service can detain mail temporarily during legal proceedings related to violations. Upon proper showing, the court can enter an order for the detention of the defendant's incoming and outgoing mail during legal proceedings related to violations of Postal Service regulations. The court can detain mail related to Postal Service violations upon proof of likelihood of success on the merits. Detained mail must be examined by the defendant at the post office and delivered if not part of the legal proceedings. Definitions for "cigarette" and "roll-your-own-tobacco" are provided. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include definitions for "smokeless tobacco." Amendments are made to administrative subpoenas and semiannual reports under title 39, United States Code. Additionally, changes are made to the Tariff Act of 1930 regarding subparagraphs and definitions. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include definitions for cigarettes, smokeless tobacco, or roll-your-own tobacco. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 30 of title 39, United States Code. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to define certain tobacco products. Amendments made by this section will take effect 60 days after the enactment of the Act. Semiannual reports will be affected by the amendments made by subsection (c). Additionally, a technical correction is made. SEC. 2. TECHNICAL CORRECTION. Amends sections of title 39, United States Code by replacing "409(d)" with "409(g)(2)". The effective date of the amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Postal Accountability and Enhancement Act.
